  • Description: The package was found to be wet and brought to QA for processing. The package was placed in a plastic-lined bin to contain the spill. Insufficient inner packaging was used and the bottles tipped on their sides inside the package. One cap came off and the contents leaked.

item.title: Report X-2024050292
item.description:
Report X-2024050292

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-09T15:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A HEAVY TOOLBOX FOR INVESTIGATION OF THE CONTENTS DUE TO THE LOADER SEEING SOME TYPE OF FLAMMABLE ITEM THROUGH THE TOP OF THE TOOLBOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SEVEN LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH TWO MILWAUKEE DRILLS AMONG VARIOUS OTHER FLAMMABLE ITEMS. THERE IS (1) 4 OUNCE CONTAINER OF LIQUID TAPE (UN1133, ADHESIVES), (3) PAINT-RITER LIQUID PAINT MARKERS (UN1263, PAINT), (2) 1 OUNCE TUBES OF CROSS CHECK TORQUE SEAL (UN1263, PAINT), (1) 5.6 OUNCE CAN OF MAG TORCH BUTANE (UN2037, RECEPTACLES SMALL CONTAINING GAS) AND (1) LIGHTER (UN1057, LIGHTERS). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER TOOLBOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS DISCOVERED AND INSPECTED PRIOR TO ACTUALLY BEING LOADED ON A FLIGHT.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO HAZMAT AUDITOR HOLDING AREA FOR A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED PACKAGE DISCOVERED BY CUSTOMER COUNTER CLERK. PACKAGE WAS SUPPOSED TO CONTAIN AUTO PARTS AS DECLARED BY THE SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE HAD 3 PAINT CANS. PACKAGE IN BEING HELD FOR REGULATORY INSPECTION.

item.title: Report E-2024050014
item.description:
Report E-2024050014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: WATERFORD TOWNSHIP
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) pounds of material released from one (1) 100-pound cardboard box due to a rip against the trailer wall during offloading. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the released material and containerized the recovered material into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum along with the spent PPE. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
